rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Professor Thomas is a knowledgeable and insightful lecturer. I thoroughly enjoyed the topics discussed in lecture and truly learned a great deal from him. Though the TAs were difficult graders at times, conversing with them or Professor Thomas will help! Effort is required for the course, but it is a must to take with him! Pay attention in class!

Thomas crafts very confusing yet amazing lectures that made me feel like a fool; however he does not expect papers or questions to be of the same academic level. I had an introductory course with him, and although i didn't understand most of his sentence, I could grasp the concepts. I never did the online readings and still got an A.

Talked super fast and barely explained the terms he used and he used a lot. Only 5 grades total. 3 papers and 2 tests. He doesn't grade them and the TAs grade super hard. No curve. No extra credit. He posts powerpoints online but they're only pictures so they didn't help. First test is take home but SO HARD! 2-3 30 page readings a week. Don't take.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Megan is pretty cool. Her lectures are straight forward, though her paper assignments are a little vague. Always willing to meet outside of class. We had two group presentations and two papers, but nothing harder than normal.

I clicked "beware of group projects" because there are some, but frankly that was the best part of this class. Everything this professor assigned was useful, fun, and clear, and definitely worth the time (meaning I learned from the things we did). I thought this would be a throw away class; pleasantly surprised how engaging and cool Megan was.
